title: IGNITE-15504 .NET: Modernize project structure
body:
* Update all projects (csproj files) to use SDK-style format https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/core/project-sdk/overview#project-files
* Remove nuspec files, use csproj properties instead.
* Target netstandard2.0 in modern libraries (Core, Linq, loggers).
* Target net461 in legacy libraries (EF, ASP.NET).
* Target netcoreapp3.1 in examples (lowest supported .NET Core version at the moment).
* Use dotnet CLI to build binaries and packages: this works on any OS, even for legacy Windows-only libraries.
* Delete legacy NuGet tests.
* Update build.ps1 - remove complicated logic for nuget and binaries, use simple dotnet CLI commands.

As a result:
* Nothing should change for the users.
* Visual Studio is not required.
* The only requirement is .NET Core SDK 3.1.
* Build procedure is trivial and works on any OS.
* Future SDK upgrades are trivial.

title: IGNITE-13631 Improve data storage metrics descriptions
IGNITE-14453: Fix a NullPointerException when persistence is enabled with java 15+
body:
Changes Made:

1. Added openjdk17 to travis, so java17 (the latest LTS release) can be tested 
2. Added java-15+ profile and augment 9+ to 9-to-14. java-15+ will have a source of 1.8 and a target of 17 (the first and only LTS currently in the range), similar to java-9+ having a source of 1.8 and a target of 11.
3. Split out FileWriteHandleImpl in to FileWriteHandlePreJDK15 and FileWriteHandleJDK15Plus. The one we choose to instantiate is based on the java.version system property.
4. FileWriteHandlePreJDK15 should act identically to the old FileWriteHandleImpl.
5. FileWriteHandleJDK15Plus incorporates the patch submitted to IGNITE-14453 by Aaron Anderson

Still TODO:
- [ ] Test if this PR works in java 8, 11, and 17.
- [ ] Go through the rest of the Contribution Checklist at the end of this body.
- [ ] Look at the history of those java-9+ values to see the thought process behind it, before taking this PR out of draft form.
- [ ] Study https://openjdk.java.net/jeps/393 to see if it's a better long term solution that would be worth the effort, rather than merging in this PR.
- [ ] Check if the tool module java-9+ profile must match the new parent java-9-to-14 profile. I'm hoping it doesn't.

- [X] There is a single JIRA ticket related to the pull request. 
- [x] The web-link to the pull request is attached to the JIRA ticket.

title: IGNITE-15391 Add support for creating IndexQuery without index name
body: Make index name optional for IndexQuery. Then Ignite find an index for query by list of criteria fields. Order of fields in the criteria list doesn't matter.

title: IGNITE-14068 : Infinite node presence in the ring while outgoing connections are lost
body:
If node looses outgoing connections, it can decide it is alone in the cluster and won't fail. Happens on small clusters where failed node attempts to connect to every other node before connRecoveryTimeout expires.

Consider:

The cluster n1 -> n2 -> n3 -> n4 -> n1
n4 looses all outgoing connections.
n3 keeps successful ping to n4.
n4 attempts to connect to n1, n2, n3. Fails with each due to outgoing network failure.
spi.connrecoveryTimeout is not reached. n4 decides it is alone and continues working.
n3 still sends messages to n4. n4 does not lack incoming connections.
ring is actually broken because of n4. n3 cannot determine failure of n4.
Solution: node could watch its incoming traffic which notyfies of the incoming network. If all the outgoing connections are lost but messages are received, node must left the grid to prevent ring break.

title: IGNITE-15289 Global statistics collection
body:
Add new IgniteGlobalStatisticsManager to gather global statistics from the local ones. They choose some statistics master node for each table and request it when they need global statistics (collect by request only). 
Global statistics will be cached until its configuration changed. Statistics master node in its turn will send requests to get appropriate (fresh config enough with specified topology version) local statistics from each node and aggregate it to the global one. Then it'll respond to each global statistics request. If topology change occurs during global statistics aggregation - all progress should be dropped and aggregation should be restarted automatically.
To support such a mechanism two additional messages were introduced: StatisticsRequest and StatisticsResponse. To track which global statistics are available on a particular node StatisticsGlobalData view was added (like StatisticsLocalData, but contains global characteristics of the tables).
IgniteTableImpl now relies on global statistics instead of local ones so most tests were switched from local to global statistics checks. Anyway - global statistics require a local one.
